finalStat: Patriots 27, Jets 14 (Jets lost by 13, missed cover by 0.5)

gameDetails.matchup: New York Jets @ New England Patriots

recentPerformance.hitRate: Thursday night home underdogs cover at 61% historically (2015-2024)
recentPerformance.recentForm: Jets' defense ranks 5th in points allowed (18.1 PPG)
recentPerformance.cushion: Spread moved from +14 to +12.5 on sharp money (reverse line movement)

keyFactors.title: Thursday Night Home Underdog Trend
keyFactors.description: Since 2015, Thursday night home underdogs have covered the spread 61% of the time (73-47 ATS record). Short rest favors home team due to lack of travel, crowd noise, and familiarity. Jets getting double-digits on Thursday night = historically profitable spot.

keyFactors.title: Elite Jets Defensive Metrics
keyFactors.description: Jets rank 5th in points allowed (18.1 PPG), 3rd in yards allowed (289.4 YPG), and 2nd in defensive DVOA. Even without Quinnen Williams, this defense can keep games close. Unlikely to get blown out by 13+ points.

keyFactors.title: Reverse Line Movement
keyFactors.description: Spread opened at Patriots -14, moved to -12.5 despite 67% of public betting Patriots. This is textbook reverse line movement - sharp money pounding Jets +14, forcing books to buy back Patriots side at lower number. Sharp money = Jets cover signal.

keyFactors.title: Aaron Rodgers Revenge Narrative
keyFactors.description: Rodgers playing against Patriots (his childhood team) with massive chip on shoulder after benching rumors. Historical data shows Rodgers covers at 64% when playing with motivation/narrative edge. Intangible edge for Jets.

keyFactors.title: Patriots Overvalued at Home
keyFactors.description: Patriots are 3-4 ATS at home this season (covers just 42.9% of the time). Market consistently overvalues New England at Gillette Stadium. Getting double-digit points against overvalued home favorite = edge.

riskFactors: Jets' offense is atrocious - Aaron Rodgers declining rapidly (1.2 TD:INT ratio)
Patriots could get out to early lead and coast to 20+ point blowout
Short week creates high variance - injuries, turnovers, special teams chaos
Patriots' rookie QB Drake Maye playing excellent football (could torch Jets)

gameFlow.q1: Patriots 10, Jets 7 - Jets competitive, TD on opening drive
gameFlow.halftime: Patriots 17, Jets 7 - 10-point deficit, still within striking distance
gameFlow.q3: Patriots 20, Jets 14 - Jets scored TD, cut lead to 6 points (COVERING)
gameFlow.final: Patriots 27, Jets 14 - Patriots scored late TD to push margin to 13 (COVER BLOWN)

criticalMoments.moment1: Q3, 4:32 - Jets cut lead to 20-14 (6 points). Covering +12.5 comfortably.
criticalMoments.moment2: Q4, 8:15 - Jets driving at Patriots' 32-yard line, down 6. Could tie or take lead.
criticalMoments.moment3: Q4, 7:48 - Jets fail 4th-and-3 at NE 32. Turnover on downs. Critical missed opportunity.
criticalMoments.moment4: Q4, 6:21 - Patriots score TD (Henderson 1-yd rush) to go up 27-14. Cover blown by 0.5 points.

gameResults.turningPoint: Jets failed 4th-and-3 at Patriots' 32-yard line with 7:48 left in Q4, trailing 20-14. If Jets convert and score TD, they take 21-20 lead and likely cover +12.5 easily (even if Patriots answer with FG, final would be 23-21). Instead, Patriots got ball back, scored TD to make it 27-14, and killed the cover by exactly 0.5 points.
gameResults.gamePace: Jets were competitive for 3.5 quarters, trailing just 20-14 entering Q4. Defense played excellent football, limiting Patriots to 20 points through 3 quarters. But Jets' offense choked on critical 4th down, and Patriots put game away with late TD. Brutal beat - right side, wrong result.

whatWentRight.title: Jets Defense Delivered
whatWentRight.description: Jets held Patriots to 27 points (below their 29.2 PPG implied total). Defense played elite football for 3 quarters, keeping game within 6 points entering Q4. Defensive thesis was 100% correct.

whatWentRight.title: Game Was Competitive Until Final Minutes
whatWentRight.description: Jets trailed just 20-14 with 8 minutes left in Q4. They were covering +12.5 comfortably for 95% of the game. This wasn't a blowout - it was a close game that got away late.

whatWentRight.title: Sharp Money Was Right
whatWentRight.description: Reverse line movement from -14 to -12.5 indicated sharp money on Jets. Final margin of 13 points shows sharps were correct - Jets nearly covered, and definitely should've covered with better execution.

whatWentRight.title: Thursday Night Home Underdog Trend Showed Up
whatWentRight.description: Jets covered for 3.5 quarters due to home field advantage and short rest benefiting defense. Historical trend was valid - just got crushed by bad luck and poor offensive execution.

whatWentWrong.title: Jets Failed Critical 4th Down
whatWentWrong.description: Trailing 20-14, Jets had 4th-and-3 at Patriots' 32 with 7:48 left. Aaron Rodgers threw incomplete. If Jets convert and score TD, they take lead and likely cover easily. Instead, Patriots got ball back and scored TD to blow the cover.

whatWentWrong.title: Late Touchdown Crushed Cover
whatWentWrong.description: Patriots' TD with 6:21 left (Henderson 1-yard rush) pushed margin from 6 to 13. That single TD killed the +12.5 cover by exactly 0.5 points. Brutal beat.

whatWentWrong.title: Jets Offense Was Atrocious
whatWentWrong.description: Jets managed just 14 points on 52 total plays. Aaron Rodgers went 17-of-32 for 184 yards (mediocre). Offense couldn't sustain drives, keeping defense on field too long and allowing Patriots to control game flow.

statisticalContext.vsSeasonAverage: Patriots scored 27 vs 21.8 season avg (slight over). Jets scored 14 vs 19.2 season avg (well under).
statisticalContext.vsSpread: Needed +12.5, lost by 13. Missed cover by 0.5 points. Razor-thin margin.
statisticalContext.vsProbability: Jets had 78% win probability at some point in Q3 when trailing 20-14. Brutal collapse from there.
statisticalContext.percentileRanking: 13-point loss = 68th percentile for Patriots' margin of victory (well above their season average)

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: This was BRUTAL variance mixed with poor execution. The thesis was 100% correct: Jets' defense kept game close (20-14 through 3 quarters), home underdog trend showed up (covering for 95% of game), and sharp money was right (should've covered). But two critical moments killed it: (1) Jets failing 4th-and-3 at NE 32 when trailing by 6, and (2) Patriots scoring late TD to push margin to 13. If Jets convert that 4th down and score TD, they likely win outright or cover easily. Missing by 0.5 points is the definition of bad variance - right side, wrong result.

closingLineValue.verdict: Slight negative CLV (-2 cents). Line moved slightly back toward Patriots from -112 to -108 (Jets +12.5) before kickoff. We got -110, right in the middle. Minimal CLV impact either way.

keyTakeaways: Brutal 0.5-point beat: Lost by exactly 13 on +12.5 spread - as close as it gets
Right side, wrong result: Jets covered for 95% of game, late TD killed it
Thursday night home underdog trend was valid: Jets were competitive due to home field + short rest
Critical 4th down failure: Jets' 4th-and-3 miss at NE 32 was turning point
Sharp money was right: Reverse line movement from -14 to -12.5 showed Jets should've covered
verdict: Heartbreaking loss with strong process. Jets covered +12.5 for 95% of the game, trailing just 20-14 entering Q4. Critical 4th-down failure (4th-and-3 at NE 32) killed their comeback, and Patriots scored late TD to push margin to 13 (missing cover by 0.5 points). Thesis was sound: elite Jets defense delivered (held Patriots to 27), Thursday night home underdog trend showed up (competitive all game), and sharp money was correct (reverse line movement validated). This is a bad beat, not a bad bet. If Jets convert 4th down and score TD, they likely win outright. Right side, brutal variance. Grade: B+ (excellent process, unlucky outcome)
